titleStmt.title: E. H. Smith et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6414

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency Thos, E, Bramlett
Govenor of The Commonwealth Ky

The undersigned Petitioners would respectfully state that ^at^ the present Term of the Grant Circuit Court Geo Williams was fined fifty Dollars for carrying concealed weapons upon his person We know Mr Williams well -- he is an old man; upward of seventy years, is a cripple; draws a Pension for injuries rcd in the war of 1812. and withall a very poor man We respectfully ask your Excellency to remit so much of the sd fine as is in your Power -- 23d May 1865

E H Smith
John Marksbury
O, D, Mcmanaman
A Lingenfelter
A. W. Childess
John Metcalfe
T A Franklin Ck Co Ct
B. N. Carter J. P. G. C.
J. F. Shriff
Jas B Hume
J M Collins
N. H. Jeffers C. G. C. C.
D. E. Craig
W. T. Simmons
W L Rankin
B Stewart, M, C, G, C, C
O P Hogan
P. F. Hansbrough
B. F. Sarcy
Alfred Rickers
A Kendall
N. Stewart J. P. G. C
J E Stone J P G C
P. L. Mcbatton J. P. G. C
W N Simpson

Grant Cir Ct
vs
Geo Williams
$50,
Concealed Weapons
Remitted
3d June/65
